description: A low-level 5V 4-channel relay interface board with SPDT relays capable of handling AC250V 10A or DC30V 10A loads. Each channel requires 15-20mA driver current and can be powered by 5V or 12V supply. Features optocoupler isolation and anti‑interference protection.
application_examples: Control household appliances from an Arduino or Raspberry Pi
Switch high‑current AC or DC loads

special_features: Standard interface for microcontrollers (8051, AVR, PIC, DSP, ARM, MSP430, TTL logic)

getting_started.connection_guide: Connect VCC to 5V (or 12V) of the MCU, GND to ground, IN1‑IN4 to digital output pins, and JD‑VCC to an external 5V supply if using separate power. For Arduino, use pins 12, 11, 10, 9. For Raspberry Pi, use GPIO 22, 27, 17, 18.
